item.title: 美联储必须防止关税助长持续通胀：罗根
item.description: 达拉斯联储主席洛里-洛根周四在讲话中表示，高于预期的关税 "很可能 "会同时提高失业率和通胀率，她在讲话中明确表示，她最关心的是控制通胀和通胀预期。【原文：Higher-than-expected tariffs would "very likely" raise both unemployment and inflation, Dallas Federal Reserve President Lorie Logan said on Thursday in remarks that made clear her most immediate concern is keeping inflation, and inflation expectations, in check.】

item.title: 通用汽车调整生产，将在全电动汽车工厂裁员 200 人
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周四表示，该公司将在底特律的纯电动零工厂（Factory Zero）裁员，并调整生产 "以适应市场动态"。【原文：General Motors is laying off workers at its all-electric Factory Zero plant in Detroit where it is adjusting production "to align with market dynamics," the company said Thursday.】

item.title: 近年来最大的奢侈品交易
item.description: 周四，普拉达（Prada）与卡普里控股公司（Capri Holdings）达成收购较小竞争对手范思哲（Versace）的协议，将意大利时尚界的两大巨头联合在一起。普拉达表示，该交易的企业价值为 13.75 亿美元。【原文：Prada struck a deal to buy smaller rival Versace from Capri Holdings on Thursday in a move to unite two of the biggest names in Italian fashion. The deal has an enterprise value of $1.375 billion, Prada said.】

item.title: 美国非卖品连锁店因关税发挥采购和库存优势而获胜
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）对中国制造的服装、箱包和鞋征收的激进关税，可能会使 TJ Maxx 和 Ross 等依靠扩张性采购战略和库存管理的非价格零售商受益。【原文：Aggressive tariffs on China-made clothes, bags and shoes by U.S. President Donald Trump could benefit off-price retailers such as TJ Maxx and Ross who rely on expansive sourcing strategies and inventory management.】

item.title: 普拉达将范思哲带回家，打造意大利奢侈品竞争者
item.description: 普拉达（Prada）收购范思哲（Versace）的交易重新燃起了人们对 "意大利制造 "奢侈品冠军的希望，此前许多其他家族创立的品牌最终都落入了法国、瑞士或美国的手中。【原文：Prada's deal to buy Versace revives hopes for a 'Made in Italy' luxury champion after many other family-founded brands ended up in French, Swiss or U.S. hands, and comes as many Italian groups are outperforming the struggling sector.】

item.title: VIEW 3月CPI冷淡可能只是关税引发通胀的短暂干扰
item.description: 美国消费者价格在 3 月份意外下降，但在唐纳德-特朗普总统在降低对其他国家的关税的同时加倍征收进口中国商品的关税之后，通胀风险向好的方向倾斜。【原文：U.S. consumer prices unexpectedly fell in March, but inflation risks are tilted to the upside after President Donald Trump doubled down on tariffs on imported Chinese goods even as he lowered duties on other nations.】

item.title: 人工智能网络芯片初创公司 nEye Systems 融资 5800 万美元，由 Alphabet 的 CapitalG 基金领投
item.description: 为人工智能数据中心开发新型网络芯片的初创公司 NEye Systems 周四获得了 5800 万美元的风险融资，本轮融资由 Alphabet 支持的成长期基金 CapitalG 领投。【原文：NEye Systems, a startup developing a new kind of networking chip for artificial intelligence data centers, on Thursday raised $58 million in venture financing in a round led by CapitalG, a growth-stage fund backed by Alphabet .】

item.title: 通胀数据疲软，交易员增加对美联储降息的押注
item.description: 周四，交易商押注美国联邦储备委员会将在6月恢复降息，并可能在年底前将其政策利率下调整整一个百分点。此前的数据显示，上个月的通货膨胀率比经济学家预期的要低。【原文：Traders on Thursday bet the U.S. Federal Reserve will resume cutting interest rates in June and probably deliver a full percentage point of reductions to its policy rate by the end of the year. after data showed inflation last month was softer than economists had expected.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数小幅上升
item.description: 上周，新申请失业救济金的美国人数量略有上升，而且随着公司应对唐纳德-特朗普总统的进口关税政策，申请失业救济金的人数可能呈上升趋势。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits rose slightly last week and could trend higher as companies navigate President Donald Trump's tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 美国买家以最高价抢购西班牙房产
item.description: 周四的数据显示，在去年所有外国买家中，腰缠万贯的美国公民为西班牙房产支付了最高的价格，同时在中部和北部一些地区购买了最多的房产，这加剧了该国的住房危机。【原文：Deep-pocketed U.S. citizens paid the highest prices for Spanish property of all foreign buyers last year, while making the most purchases in some central and northern regions, data showed on Thursday, exacerbating a housing crisis in the country.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息称新加坡 SC Capital 正在洽谈收购英国数据中心集团 Global Switch
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，总部位于新加坡的房地产投资管理公司 SC Capital Partners 已成为英国数据中心集团 Global Switch 的潜在竞购者。【原文：Singapore-headquartered real estate investment manager SC Capital Partners has emerged as a potential bidder for British data centre group Global Switch, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国 3 月份消费者价格意外下降
item.description: 美国消费者价格在 3 月份意外下降，但在唐纳德-特朗普总统在降低对其他国家的关税的同时加倍征收进口中国商品的关税之后，通胀风险向好的方向倾斜。【原文：U.S. consumer prices unexpectedly fell in March, but inflation risks are tilted to the upside after President Donald Trump doubled down on tariffs on imported Chinese goods even as he lowered duties on other nations.】

item.title: 关税引发不确定性和增长担忧，美国地区银行面临业绩考验
item.description: 下周，美国地区银行将陆续公布第一季度业绩报告，投资者将追踪资产质量方面的压力迹象，而美国关税引发的不确定性加剧很可能会成为焦点。【原文：Heightened uncertainty fueled by the on-and-off U.S. tariffs will likely take center stage as the nation's regional banks gear up to report first-quarter results next week, with investors tracking signs of stress in asset quality.】

item.title: 特朗普关税激怒市场，2025 年石油价格接近股票价格
item.description: 全球石油基准布伦特原油与美国股票之间的正相关性在 2025 年再次出现，反映了人们对经济放缓和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易战影响的担忧。【原文：A positive correlation between global oil benchmark Brent crude and U.S. equities has reemerged in 2025, reflecting concern about the slowing economy and the impact of U.S. President Donald Trump's trade wars.】

item.title: 意大利普拉达同意收购时装竞争对手范思哲
item.description: 普拉达（Prada）已达成协议，将从卡普里控股公司（Capri Holdings）手中收购规模较小的竞争对手范思哲（Versace），从而将意大利时尚界的两大巨头联合起来。普拉达周四表示，该交易的企业价值为 13.75 亿美元。【原文：Prada has struck a deal to buy smaller rival Versace from Capri Holdings in a move to unite two of the biggest names in Italian fashion. The deal has an enterprise value of $1.375 billion, Prada said on Thursday.】

item.title: 白宫哈塞特称美国接近与贸易伙伴达成贸易协议
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）周四表示，美国正在考虑15个国家提出的关税协议，并接近与其中一些国家达成协议。【原文：The United States is considering offers from 15 countries on tariff agreements and is close to deals with some of them, White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said on Thursday after President Donald Trumplowered some of the duties in a stunning reversal.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，宝洁公司与可口可乐装瓶商一起成为欧盟反垄断调查的目标
item.description: 据彭博社周四援引知情人士的话报道，汰渍洗涤剂生产商宝洁公司已被确定为欧盟反垄断监管机构上月启动的调查对象，该调查还针对可口可乐装瓶商。【原文：Tide detergent maker Procter & Gamble has been identified as the subject of an EU antitrust regulators' investigation initiated last month that had also targeted Coca-Cola bottlers, Bloomberg reported on Thursday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 二手车零售商 CarMax 第四季度利润不及预期
item.description: 二手车零售商 CarMax 周四公布的第四季度利润不及华尔街预期，原因是较高的借贷成本使一些消费者不敢购买大件商品。【原文：Used-car retailer CarMax on Thursday reported a fourth-quarter profit that missed Wall Street estimates, as higher borrowing costs kept some consumers from making big ticket purchases.】

item.title: 全球首个仿人机器人半程马拉松赛因大风天气推迟举行
item.description: 北京推迟了原定于周日举行的半程马拉松比赛，在这场比赛中，仿人机器人将与人类选手并肩作战，这是一场里程碑式的比赛，旨在展示中国在前沿产业领域取得的进步。【原文：Beijing has postponed a half marathon originally scheduled for Sunday in which humanoid robots will race alongside human runners, a milestone designed to showcase China's advances in a frontier industry the country is intent on dominating.】

item.title: 瑞银股东以 90% 的选票再次选举科尔姆-凯莱赫为主席
item.description: 瑞银股东周四以 90% 的选票再次选举科尔姆-凯莱赫（Colm Kelleher）为主席，而 2024 年的得票率为 96%。【原文：UBS shareholders on Thursday reelected Chairman Colm Kelleher with 90% of votes, compared to 96% of votes in 2024.】

item.title: 英国监管机构称可能接受 SLB 和 ChampionX 提出的补救措施
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周四表示，可能会接受油田服务公司 SLB 和规模较小的竞争对手 ChampionX 提出的措施，以解决两家公司拟议的 80 亿美元交易中的反垄断问题。【原文：Britain's competition regulator said on Thursday it might accept the measures offered by oilfield services firm SLB and smaller rival ChampionX to address antitrust concerns regarding the two companies' proposed $8 billion deal.】

item.title: 早间竞标再猜测九十天
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 亚马逊首席执行官在年度股东信中阐述人工智能投资使命
item.description: 亚马逊首席执行官安迪-贾西（Andy Jassy）周四为公司数十亿美元的人工智能开发支出进行了辩解，称这项投资是保持竞争力所必需的。【原文：Amazon chief executive Andy Jassy on Thursday justified the company's billions of dollars in outlays for artificial intelligence development, saying the investment was necessary to remain competitive.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商 Polestar 的季度销售额因优惠和折扣而猛增
item.description: 周四，电动汽车制造商 Polestar 的第一季度销售额猛增 76%，原因是折扣和优惠帮助抵消了激烈的竞争和不确定的经济前景。【原文：Electric vehicle maker Polestar's first-quarter sales jumped 76% on Thursday as discounts and offers helped offset stiff competition and an uncertain economic outlook.】

item.title: 意法半导体寻求就投资和就业水平向意大利作出保证
item.description: 芯片制造商意法半导体（STMicroelectronics）周四向意大利保证其对意大利的承诺，因为罗马政府向该公司首席执行官施加了辞职压力。【原文：Chipmaker STMicroelectronics moved on Thursday to reassure Italy of its commitment to the country as the Rome government puts pressure on the company's chief executive to quit.】

item.title: 瑞银股东以 86.7% 的票数支持 2024 年薪酬报告
item.description: 在周四的咨询投票中，瑞银股东以 86.7% 的票数支持该行 2024 年的薪酬报告，而去年同期的支持率为 83.5%。【原文：In an advisory vote, UBS shareholders on Thursday backed the bank's 2024 compensation report with 86.7% of votes, compared to 83.5% for the same report a year earlier.】

item.title: 解说员：美国国债市场刚刚发生了什么？
item.description: 一周前，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）决定暂停他曾表示要对数十个国家征收的巨额关税，随后金融市场出现动荡，包括 29 万亿美元的国债市场急剧下挫。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's decision to pause the hefty duties he had said he would impose on dozens of countries one week ago followed turmoil in financial markets that included an acute selloff in the $29 trillion Treasury market.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官陈立武在中国的广泛投资
item.description: 英特尔首席执行官陈立武数十年来通过他于 1987 年在旧金山创立的风险投资公司华登国际和两家香港控股公司，对中国公司进行了数百次投资。【原文：Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan has made hundreds of investments in Chinese companies over decades through Walden International, the San Francisco venture capital firm he founded in 1987, and two Hong Kong-based holding companies.】

item.title: 澳大利亚央行称关税不确定性下决定利率路径为时尚早
item.description: 澳大利亚最高央行行长周四表示，现在决定利率路径还为时过早，并补充说在评估美国贸易政策对经济的影响时需要保持耐心，因为这些政策已经颠覆了金融市场。【原文：Australia's top central banker said on Thursday that it was still too early to decide on the path for interest rates, adding it needed to be patient as it assesses the economic impact of U.S. trade policies that have upended financial markets.】

item.title: 聚焦：华尔街对关税冲击的反应：客户来电和奖金担忧
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布征收最新关税后，市场暴跌，花旗集团银行业主管维斯瓦斯-拉加万（Viswas Raghavan）周一召集全球高级银行家开会，让他们与客户通电话。【原文：With markets crashing after U.S. President Donald Trump announced his latest tariffs, Citigroup’s banking head Viswas Raghavan called a global meeting of senior bankers on Monday and told them to get on the phone with their clients.】
